more.about:
Tennis-Play is a platform for organizing tennis tournaments and matches.

We offer:
- Convenient tournament registration system
- Rating system
- Organizing matches with players of your level
- Statistics and match history

Learn more on our website: https://tennis-tournaments.com/contacts/
more.contacts:
For all questions about the bot and suggestions, write to:

dating_additional.habits: Bad habits: Attitude to smoking, alcohol

tennis_levels.1.5: Player has little experience, improving stroke consistency in play
tennis_levels.2.0: Player shows deficiencies in basic strokes. Has shortened backswing, cannot choose shot direction. Often players at this level rarely use backhand, hold racket incorrectly. Generally reluctant to play at net
tennis_levels.2.5: Player attempts to anticipate ball direction but court sense is still poorly developed. Also has some problems with racket grip, approach to ball, prefers to run around forehand. Still has difficulties at net. Can maintain play at low tempo with players of same level
tennis_levels.3.0: Player already returns medium-paced balls well but cannot always control power, direction and depth of shots. Forehands work best. Attempts to strengthen serve, leading to errors. Second serve usually significantly weaker than first. At net has difficulties with low passing shots. Can execute simple and medium-difficulty lobs reasonably well
tennis_levels.3.5: Player can control direction of medium-difficulty shots, though lacks some control of depth and variety, vision and court sense improving. Player can execute weak directed shots from left, but powerful shots and high bounces still need work. Serve shows sufficient power and control. Plays more actively at net, reaches some passing shots. Consistently executes smash on easy balls
tennis_levels.4.0: Player can execute varied shots, controls depth and direction of shots from both right and left. Has lob, smash, volleys and powerful passing shots in arsenal. First serve executed powerfully, sometimes at expense of accuracy. Has experience using team tactics in doubles
tennis_levels.4.5: Very varied shots on ball, effectively uses power and spin. Attacks powerfully from left, only makes errors under pressure. Player skillfully uses power and topspin on shots, can control game tempo, works well with feet, controls depth of shots and can change tactics depending on opponent. Player has strong and accurate first serve, consistently executes second, can attack near net
tennis_levels.5.0: Player feels ball excellently and can often execute special shots that game is built on. Athlete can win points, 'kill' balls on fly, can force opponent to make errors with short balls, successfully applies lobs, smashes, half-volleys, and executes second serve deep with strong topspin
tennis_levels.5.5: Main weapons of tennis player in game are powerful shots and consistency. Depending on situation athlete can change strategy and technique, can execute reliable shots in difficult moments
tennis_levels.6.0: Player at this level has good qualification and does not need NTRP classification. Usually athletes with 6.0 rating participate in national junior competitions and have national rating
tennis_levels.6.5: Player at 6.5 level is close to 7.0 in skill and has experience participating in satellite tournaments
tennis_levels.7.0: World-class athlete participating in various international-level tennis tournaments. Main source of income for top-level player is prize money from competitions

table_tennis_levels.1.0: Beginner - just starting to play, learning basics
table_tennis_levels.1.5: Novice - can return ball but with errors:(
table_tennis_levels.2.0: Student - understands basics but technique unstable
table_tennis_levels.3.5: Amateur+ - good technique, can play with spin
table_tennis_levels.4.0: Advanced - masters all strokes, good tactics
table_tennis_levels.4.5: Advanced+ - stable play at high level
